item.title: Vote discrepancy halts counting at JnU
item.description: Jagannath University’s Central Student Union (JnUCSU) election has run into trouble during vote counting following a peaceful polling process. A discrepancy in a single vote has suspended the counting for over two hours as the authorities work to verify results. “We have encountered a

item.title: G7 finance ministers to meet in Washington to discuss rare earths, three sources say
item.description: Finance ministers from the Group of Seven nations will meet in Washington on January 12 to discuss rare earths supplies, three sources familiar with the matter said on Tuesday. One of the sources added that price floors for rare earths would be a point of discussion, among other critical mineral t

item.title: Rana Pratap Bairagi killing in Jashore not linked to religion, journalism: Govt
item.description: The government today clarified that the killing of Rana Pratap Bairagi in Jashore was not linked to religion or any journalistic matter, saying that local police have confirmed the victim was already an accused in a murder case. “You know that a murder took place in Jashore yesterday (Monday

item.title: Bangladesh has no plan to import beef: Adviser Farida
item.description: Bangladesh has no plan to import beef, as it could hurt domestic farmers and pose potential health risks, said Fisheries and Livestock Adviser Farida Akhter on Tuesday. “Beef import requires careful consideration. It is not like soap or shampoo that can be brought in at will. The government

item.title: Limits of monetary policy independence
item.description: The issue of central bank independence has two elements. First— governance, how is the central bank governed? Are its leadership appointments merit-based? item.title: War on sovereignty of Venezuela not narcotics
item.description: The U.S. military operation resulting in the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife represents a defining moment in the Trump administration's fight against alleged drug trafficking. item.title: Completing NBR reform
item.description: Splitting the National Board of Revenue (NBR) between its policymaking and revenue management functions has been one of the major reform agendas of the post-July 2024 interim government. The aim was to render the tax regulator more efficient, transparent and accountable. Though the inte

item.title: EU Ambassador meets Tarique Rahman
item.description: European Union (EU) Ambassador to Bangladesh Michael Miller today (Tuesday) held a courtesy meeting with BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman. The meeting took place at the BNP Chairperson's office in Gulshan at 6:30pm, according to BNP Media Cell member Shayrul Kabir Khan, BSS reports.

item.title: Corruption corrodes ICT-powered knowledge economy
item.description: sector steeped in misdealing sending billions of fast bucks into pockets of a small group of politically and commercially favoured firms. item.title: Ex-industries Minister Kamal Ahmed admitted to DMCH due to illness
item.description: Former industries minister Kamal Ahmed Majumdar (75) was admitted to Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) on Tuesday after falling ill at Keraniganj Central Jail. He was brought to DMCH’s emergency department around 7:30 pm and admitted to Ward 220 of the Surgery Department for treatment, U

item.title: Over 300 SAD leaders join BNP in Sherpur
item.description: More than 300 leaders of the Students Against Discrimination (SAD) joined the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) in Sherpur on Tuesday. The student leaders completed the formalities in the afternoon at the district BNP office in Raghunath Bazar under the leadership of the district SAD chief coordi

item.title: EU, BNP discussed upcoming election, post-polls development: Nazrul
item.description: BNP standing committee member Nazrul Islam Khan said the European Union (EU) delegation held discussions with the party on the upcoming 13th national parliamentary election and the country's development outlook after the polls.
